  • The conference was primarily for the travelling Indian media, although some Australian media was invited.

summary:
Notorious stand, beer towers, and Boxing Day madness: MCG braces for Australia vs India

Publication Date: December 26, 2023 | Source: Times of India

On December 26, the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) is set to host a sold-out crowd of nearly 100,000 for the highly-anticipated Boxing Day Test between Australia and India. Security measures have been ramped up in response to the expected rowdy atmosphere, particularly from a notorious group known for their loud behavior.

  • Over 100,000 spectators expected for the match, with additional security personnel deployed.
  • Security staff count increased from 10 to up to 20 per block to manage the crowd.
  • Tickets for resale are fetching steep premiums, with prices rising from 30 AUD to upwards of 150 AUD.
  • Local marketplaces buzzing with fans reselling tickets, creating a festive and chaotic environment.
"They just come and drink. That loud bunch in those blue blocks. Beer just flows and expect the beer glass towers to get taller as the game progresses." - Security guard at MCG

The excitement leading up to the match showcases the vibrant cricket culture in Australia, with festivities continuing through the New Year.

title: 'D Gukesh will never be a player like Magnus Carlsen': Indian GM's coach Grzegorz Gajewski explains why - Firstpost
summary:
D Gukesh's Unique Style: A Coach's Perspective on Comparisons with Magnus Carlsen

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Firstpost

Grzegorz Gajewski, the coach of Indian chess prodigy D Gukesh, asserts that while Gukesh is being compared to Magnus Carlsen, their playing styles are fundamentally different. He emphasized that Gukesh has a unique method of deep calculation rather than relying on intuition.

  • D Gukesh has become the youngest world chess champion after defeating Ding Liren.
  • Coach Grzegorz Gajewski believes Gukesh will never play like Carlsen but can mimic his style.
  • Gukesh prefers deep calculations over intuitive moves, which sets him apart from Carlsen.
  • Gukesh aims to reach the level of greatness achieved by Carlsen in his career.
  • He will compete next in the Tata Steel Chess Tournament 2025.
“He will never be a player like Magnus Carlsen in the sense of being an intuitive kind of a player.” - Grzegorz Gajewski

In conclusion, Gukesh's unique approach to chess, as articulated by his coach, highlights not only his talent but also his aspiration to achieve greatness while staying true to his own style.
newTitle: D Gukesh's Unique Style: A Coach's Perspective on Comparisons with Magnus Carlsen

summary:

The Indian cricket team is embroiled in another controversy following Australian media's biased reporting against them stemming from Ravindra Jadeja's press conference intended for Indian journalists.

  • The incident was preceded by a confrontation between Virat Kohli and an Australian reporter at the airport, intensifying media tensions.
  • The press conference was hijacked by Cricket Australia’s media team, allowing Australian journalists to participate without prior coordination.
  • No Australian journalists were able to ask questions because the time was taken up by Hindi questions from Indian reporters.
  • The subsequent reaction from Australian media was misleading, linking the press conference to Kohli's earlier incident and publishing biased stories.

“Our media manager never imposed a language restriction. Ravindra Jadeja is proficient in English and would have answered any questions posed to him.”

title: ZIM vs AFG Live Streaming, 3rd ODI: How to Watch Zimbabwe vs Afghanistan Telecast in India, Afghanistan and Zimbabwe? - myKhel
Robin Uthappa, former India cricketer, faces arrest over provident fund ‘fraud’: Reports - Hindustan Times
summary:
Robin Uthappa Faces Arrest Over Provident Fund Fraud Allegations

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

An arrest warrant has been issued against former Indian cricketer Robin Uthappa in connection with an alleged EPFO fraud case where he failed to deposit provident fund contributions deducted from employees' salaries.

  • An arrest warrant was issued by PF regional commissioner Shadakshari Gopal Reddy.
  • Uthappa is accused of not depositing ₹23 lakh in provident fund contributions while managing Century Lifestyle Brand Private Limited.
  • The warrant mandates the police to arrest Uthappa and return by December 27.
  • Uthappa and his family reportedly reside in Dubai.
  • He has represented India in 59 international matches and was a prominent player in the IPL.
“The warrant which was executed on December 4 has been returned after Mr. Uthappa was found not to be at the Pulakeshinagar residence,” officials said.

This situation highlights serious allegations against Uthappa, affecting his reputation and potentially leading to legal consequences.
newTitle: Robin Uthappa Faces Arrest Over Provident Fund Fraud Allegations

title: Arrest warrant against cricketer Robin Uthappa for failing to deposit employees’ PF into their accounts - The Hindu
summary:
Arrest Warrant Issued for Cricketer Robin Uthappa Over PF Cheating Case

Published: December 21, 2024 11:48 am IST | Source: The Hindu

An arrest warrant has been issued against former India cricketer Robin Uthappa in an alleged Provident Fund (PF) cheating case. The warrant was issued by PF Regional Commissioner Shadakshari Gopal Reddy, who has asked the jurisdictional Pulakeshinagar police to take necessary action.

  • The warrant was executed on December 4 but Uthappa was not found at his residence.
  • Uthappa is accused of deducting PF contributions from employee salaries but failing to deposit those funds into their accounts.
  • He currently resides in Dubai with his family.
“The warrant which was executed on December 4 has been returned after Mr. Uthappa was found not to be at the Pulakeshinagar residence,” officials said.

This incident highlights the serious implications of financial misconduct involving employee welfare funds.
newTitle: Arrest Warrant Issued for Cricketer Robin Uthappa Over PF Cheating Case

title: Sutherland's 78-ball century overwhelms NZ in rain-hit ODI - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Sutherland's 78-Ball Century Leads Australia to Victory Over New Zealand

Date: October 2023
Source: ESPN Cricinfo

In a rain-affected ODI match, Annabel Sutherland scored a remarkable 105 not out, helping Australia to defeat New Zealand by 65 runs via the DLS method.

Key Points:

  • Australia set a target of 291 for 7.
  • Sutherland's knock was pivotal as she completed her century off just 78 balls.
  • New Zealand struggled in their run chase, finishing at 122 for 5.
  • The match was interrupted by rain, but Australia had already secured the win by the required runs.
  • Captain Alyssa Healy returned from injury, scoring 34 runs.
“Sutherland fittingly finished the innings with a boundary as her stunning rise in international cricket continued.”

This victory marks Australia's 14th consecutive ODI win, reaffirming their dominance in women's cricket.
newTitle: Sutherland's 78-Ball Century Leads Australia to Victory Over New Zealand
